summary: This is an email chain from August 13, 2019, containing a series of questions and data requests regarding staffing, inmate counts, and operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The questions appear to be part of an inquiry, likely related to the facility's conditions and staffing levels around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

persons.name: Ray
persons.context: Mentioned in the email chain as someone who needs to confirm the number of Correctional Officer positions allocated.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: The document is a staffing and operational data request for MCC New York dated August 13, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
It requests specific data on authorized vs. onboard staff and inmate counts, including for the shifts on August 9-10, 2019.
It reveals MCC New York had significant staffing shortages, with 135 authorized Correctional Officers but only 113 onboard as of August 3, 2019.
The inquiry seeks details on overtime practices, bonus incentives, and whether additional positions had been requested, indicating a review of facility management and resources.
